verbs.description: slounge (third-person singular simple present slounges, present participle slounging, simple past and past participle slounged)

entries.meaning: (UK, archaic, intransitive) To move in a slouching manner.
examples: At this he gathered his mutilated limbs to the centre of gravity, and like a genuine coward slounged away, the express image of baseness in ruins.
